Description: Fragment of cream, wool cloth with an oval tapestry (single warp threads); Tapestry- in purple-coloured wool and undyed linen; Within the oval an outline desgin of a central oval (geometric and stylised motifs) then a solid-coloured frame, then another geometric frame, another solid coloured frame, a smaller area of geometric design and finally an outer border of pointed scallops/spear heads; Warp: S spun wool, c.9tpc; Weft: S spun wool, c.52tpc in plain and tapestry areas, and S spun Z ply linen for soumak outling; Edges: all cut
Curator's comments: Unreg. 81; Similar techniques and motifs to EA72473; Previously in grey plan chest in Students' Room, also cupboard P; Cut edges post excavation; Woven as part of a larger textile - probably a tunic; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (15.5.91)
